column4: could anyone please help me? I can't understand this boot error :(
can you mount the disk file from a linux live cd? at least then you could try and recover your data prior to reinstall
what I need is about 2 dozen google chrome tabs I had open :( do you think that's written to the disk somewhere?
:( most likely, but it is probably going to be very hard to recover and then insert into a new install
I don't mind, I really need that list of sites, cause I can't get to all of them from memory
maybe if you were able to recover the entire cache dir and copy it into exactly the same place in a new install? this is why i use a real partition as opposed to wubi
this is a netbook, I was only using it for serious work because iI was travelling :/
yup. i completely sympathize. let me know if you need more. i don't know how the wubi disk file works in windows, but i imagine some sort of loop mounting would be the place to start
that's how you mount a file like it is a disk partition
my thoughts: mount windows drive, find disk file, loop mount, hunt for chrome cache location on google, copy to safe place, reinstall
I recall I once used a program that was able to mount ext2 partitions in windows. not sure if they updated it to ext3
however, windows cannot loop mount that i am aware
ya, or you can use a live cd, copying would take a while
I am trying with a live usb cause the netbook doesn't take cds :/
